derivatives.text: to bang (also run, bash,etc.) one's head against a brick wall
to hit (also run into, run up against, etc.) a brick wall
to see through a brick wall
to talk to a brick wall

etymologies: late Middle English. From brick + wall

notes.text: Often written as one word, brickwall, or with hyphen, especially in early use.

definitions: Figurative and in figurative contexts. An obstacle or obstruction; an insurmountable problem. See also to hit a brick wall.
